entries.title: 73-year-old pays $370/month to live in a plane he bought for $100,000 from a salvage yard: 'I have no regrets'
entries.description: Bruce Campbell bought the 1,066-square-foot, 200-passenger Boeing 727 from a salvage company in 1999 for $100,000.

entries.title: 'I work just 4 hours a day': This 29-year-old's side hustle brings in $2 million a year—a look at her typical day
entries.description: Miss Excel founder Kat Norton shares how turned her side hustle into a lucrative career, and how she organizes her time.

entries.title: From 'quiet quitting' to 'loud layoffs,' will career trends that created a buzz in 2022 continue in the new year?
entries.description: New buzzwords like "loud layoffs" for workplace dilemmas were coined in 2022. Experts say companies with the best solutions will attract and retain top talent.

entries.title: You got the AirPods Pro for the holidays. Here are some of the coolest features you need to know about
entries.description: The second-generation AirPods Pro have a ton of new features. Here's how to use them if you received the new headphones as a holiday gift.

entries.title: A nutritionist shares the best snacks to bring on a plane to boost your immune system
entries.description: Skip the onboard pretzels and soda, say health professionals who share ideas on ways to lower your chances of getting sick while traveling.

entries.title: How Ukraine's Zelenskyy went from comedian to wartime hero
entries.description: When Volodymyr Zelenskyy became Ukraine's president, he was a political novice. Now, he's earned global plaudits as an effective wartime leader.

entries.title: Beijing roars to life a month after zero-Covid lockdowns fade, but China is not out of the woods yet
entries.description: The rebound in social activity in Beijing is an example of how long it might take for the country to shake off the economic impact of zero-Covid controls.

entries.title: The world's in a 'polycrisis' — and these countries want to quash it by looking beyond GDP
entries.description: For a small but growing network of countries, the world's go-to metric of economic health is no longer fit for purpose.

entries.title: Top 10 most popular beach destinations in the world, according to TikTok
entries.description: A study from the holiday company Destination2 reviewed the number of views on TikTok for beaches all around the world.
